definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.chinese: 是的，我有一点点的神经质。

sentences.english: They knock each other off balance just a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 她说，“他们只是一点点敲击彼此的不平衡之处。”

sentences.english: A little bit of commercialism can help kids make connections with their peers.
sentences.chinese: 一点点的商业主义能帮助孩子们与同类人间建立联系。

sentences.english: And he was still lying about his age, just a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 他现在也虚报了年龄，说小了那么一点点。

sentences.english: A bailment of telesthesia you are in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 你是我心上一点点寄托。

sentences.english: The fiber and protein boost allows a small serving with great contentment.
sentences.chinese: 摄入一点点纤维素和蛋白质，就会得到大大的满足。

sentences.english: At a minimum, she hopes for at least a modicum of attraction.
sentences.chinese: 至少，她希望能遇到一个对她有一点点吸引力的人。

sentences.english: Hardly a whisper of concern has been voiced.
sentences.chinese: 几乎一点点关心也未曾表示过。

sentences.english: Just a little bit in a dressing spoils the whole salad?
sentences.chinese: 仅仅调料汁里的一点点就弄糟了一整盘色拉？

sentences.english: Seen from a distance, the room has only a faint light.
sentences.chinese: 从远处看，房间里只透出一点点荧火。

sentences.english: "I had no plan, not even mileage goals," she says.
sentences.chinese: “我没有计划，没有一点点目标了，”她说道。

sentences.english: But we do need a little freedom from our leashes on occasion.
sentences.chinese: 当然有时候也需要不受羁绊和一点点的自由。

sentences.english: Too often we judge people on too little information.
sentences.chinese: 我们时常通过一点点信息来评断一个人。

sentences.english: MBTs weigh slightly more than two pounds each.
sentences.chinese: 一只MBT鞋的重量是两磅多一点点。

sentences.english: She damned his character for a few faults.
sentences.chinese: 她抓住一点点毛病就说他的品质很坏。

sentences.english: Barney knew scantiest amount of French and not a syllable of anything else.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼只懂一点点法文，其他外语一个字都不会。

definition: Diandian (Chinese microblogging and social networking website)
erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
classifier indicating a small amount or small number greater than 1: some, a few, several
some/a few/a little/(following an adjective) slightly ...er
